item.title: Minimalist MATLAB Template for Scientific Figures
item.description: This template produces scientific figures with MATLAB. The figures have a minimalist design and are customized for academics and other researchers.

item.title: Minimalist LaTeX Template for Academic Papers
item.description: This template produces a research paper with LaTeX. The paper has a minimalist design and is customized for academics and scientists.

item.title: Minimalist Hugo Template for Academic Websites
item.description: This template produces a personal website with Hugo. The website has a minimalist design and is customized for academics, scientists, and researchers.

item.title: Modeling the Displacement of Native Workers by Immigrants
item.description: This paper explains why a wave of immigration reduces the employment rate of native workers, and why this reduction is larger in bad times.

item.title: Minimalist LaTeX Template for Academic Presentations
item.description: This template produces a research presentation with LaTeX and Beamer. The slides have a minimalist design and are customized for academics and scientists.

item.title: Minimalist LaTeX Commands to Write Math
item.description: This collection of minimalist commands make it easy to write mathematical expressions with LaTeX.

item.title: Critical Values Robust to P-hacking
item.description: This paper builds a model of hypothesis testing with p-hacking and gives critical values that correct the inflated type 1 error rate caused by p-hacking.

item.title: Business Cycles and How to Tame Them
item.description: This minicourse describes business cycles, develops a matching model to explain them, and discusses how monetary and fiscal policy can tame them.

item.title: u* = âˆšuv
item.description: This paper shows that under simple but realistic assumptions the efficient unemployment rate is the geometric average of the unemployment and vacancy rates.

item.title: Economic Slack
item.description: This graduate course presents matching models of economic slack and uses them to study business-cycle fluctuations, monetary policy, and fiscal policy.

item.title: An Economical Business-Cycle Model
item.description: This paper develops a policy-oriented business-cycle model with fluctuating unemployment and long zero-lower-bound episodes. Published in OEP, 2022.

item.title: Unemployment
item.description: This graduate course presents matching models of unemployment and uses them to study unemployment fluctuations, job rationing, and labor market policies.

item.title: Beveridgean Unemployment Gap
item.description: This paper develops a formula for the unemployment gap based on the Beveridge curve. In the US the gap is countercyclical. Published in JPubE Plus, 2021.

item.title: Pricing under Fairness Concerns
item.description: To explain price rigidity, this paper develops a model in which buyers care about the fairness of markups but cannot observe them. Published in JEEA, 2018.

item.title: Resolving New Keynesian Anomalies with Wealth in the Utility Function
item.description: This paper resolves the New Keynesian model's anomalies at the zero lower bound by introducing wealth in the utility function. Published in REStat, 2021.

item.title: Optimal Public Expenditure with Inefficient Unemployment
item.description: This paper shows that public expenditure should deviate from the Samuelson rule to reduce the unemployment gap, when it exists. Published in REStud, 2018.

item.title: Persistence of False Paradigms in Low-Power Sciences
item.description: This paper develops a model of science. Due to homophily in promotions, false paradigms may persist when a science has low power. Published in PNAS, 2018.

item.title: Intermediate Macroeconomics
item.description: This undergraduate course covers IS-LM model of business cycles, matching model of unemployment, inflation, and Malthusian and Solowian models of growth.

item.title: A Macroeconomic Approach to Optimal Unemployment Insurance: Applications
item.description: This paper studies how the generosity of unemployment insurance should vary over the business cycle in the United States. Published in AEJ Policy, 2018.

item.title: A Macroeconomic Approach to Optimal Unemployment Insurance: Theory
item.description: This paper develops a theory of optimal unemployment insurance in matching models. Published in AEJ Policy, 2018.

item.title: Aggregate Demand, Idle Time, and Unemployment
item.description: This paper develops a model of unemployment fluctuations in which the labor and product markets have a matching structure. Published in QJE, 2015.

item.title: A Theory of Countercyclical Government Multiplier
item.description: This paper develops a New Keynesian model in which the government multiplier doubles when unemployment rises from 5% to 8%. Published in AEJ Macro, 2014.

item.title: Mathematics for Macroeconomics
item.description: This graduate course covers basic mathematical methods for macroeconomics: dynamic programming, optimal control, and differential equations.

item.title: Do Matching Frictions Explain Unemployment? Not in Bad Times
item.description: This paper proposes a matching model of the labor market with job rationing: unemployment persists even without matching frictions. Published in AER, 2012.
